00028 #define S_FORWARD_ITERATOR(self,type,object) \
00029     self() : ::Sylph::ForwardIterator<type,object>(){ \
00030         construct(false,null); \
00031     } \
00032     self(itr_begin_t t, object* obj) : \
00033       ::Sylph::ForwardIterator<type,object>(t,obj) { \
00034         construct(true, obj); \
00035     } \
00036     self(itr_end_t t, object* obj) : \
00037       ::Sylph::ForwardIterator<type,object>(t,obj) { \
00038         construct(false, obj); \
00039     } \
00040     self(self<type,object>& other) : \
00041      ::Sylph::ForwardIterator<type,object>(other) \
00042     { copyFrom(other); }
00043 
00044 #define S_BIDIRECTIONAL_ITERATOR(self,type,object) \
00045     self() : ::Sylph::BidirectionalIterator<type,object>(){ \
00046         construct(false,null); \
00047     } \
00048     self(itr_begin_t t, object* obj) : \
00049       ::Sylph::BidirectionalIterator<type,object>(t,obj) { \
00050         construct(true, obj); \
00051     } \
00052     self(itr_end_t t, object* obj) : \
00053       ::Sylph::BidirectionalIterator<type,object>(t,obj) { \
00054         construct(false, obj); \
00055     } \
00056     self(self<type,object>& other) : \
00057      ::Sylph::BidirectionalIterator<type,object>(other) \
00058     { copyFrom(other); }
00059 
00060 #define S_RANDOM_ACCESS_ITERATOR(self,type,object) \
00061     self() : ::Sylph::RandomAccessIterator<type,object>(){ \
00062         construct(false,null); \
00063     } \
00064     self(itr_begin_t t, object* obj) : \
00065       ::Sylph::RandomAccessIterator<type,object>(t,obj) { \
00066         construct(true, obj); \
00067     } \
00068     self(itr_end_t t, object* obj) : \
00069       ::Sylph::RandomAccessIterator<type,object>(t,obj) { \
00070         construct(false, obj); \
00071     } \
00072     self(self<type,object>& other) : \
00073      ::Sylph::RandomAccessIterator<type,object>(other) \
00074     { copyFrom(other); }

00091 template<class T, class IteratedObject>
00092 class ForwardIterator : public Object {
00093 public:
00094     typedef std::forward_iterator_tag iterator_category;
00095     typedef T value_type;
00096     typedef ptrdiff_t difference_type;
00097     typedef T* pointer;
00098     typedef T& reference;
00099 public:
00100     // Implementation of the required functions in terms of the overridable
00101     // functions
00102 
00103     ForwardIterator() : _end_reached_(0) {
00104     }
00105 
00106     ForwardIterator(itr_begin_t, IteratedObject* obj) : _end_reached_(0) {
00107     }
00108 
00109     ForwardIterator(itr_end_t, IteratedObject* obj) : _end_reached_(2) {
00110     }
00111 
00112     ForwardIterator(ForwardIterator<T, IteratedObject>& other) :
00113     _end_reached_(other._end_reached_) {
00114         copyFrom(other);
00115     }
00116 
00117     virtual ~ForwardIterator() {
00118     }
00119 
00120     reference operator*() {
00121         if (_end_reached_ == 2) sthrow(IteratorException,
00122                 "Tried to derefrence an beyond-end iterator");
00123         return current();
00124     }
00125 
00126     const reference operator*() const {
00127         if (_end_reached_ == 2) sthrow(IteratorException,
00128                 "Tried to derefrence an beyond-end iterator");
00129         return current();
00130     }
00131 
00132     reference operator->() {
00133         if (_end_reached_ == 2) sthrow(IteratorException,
00134                 "Tried to derefrence an beyond-end iterator");
00135         return current();
00136     }
00137 
00138     const reference operator->() const {
00139         if (_end_reached_ == 2) sthrow(IteratorException,
00140                 "Tried to derefrence an beyond-end iterator");
00141         return current();
00142     }
00143 
00144     const ForwardIterator<T, IteratedObject> & operator++() const {
00145         if (_end_reached_ == 2) sthrow(IteratorException, "End of iterator");
00146         else if (_end_reached_ == 1) {
00147             _end_reached_ = 2;
00148             return *this;
00149         } else {
00150             next();
00151             if (!hasNext()) _end_reached_ = 1;
00152             return *this;
00153         }
00154     }
00155 
00156     ForwardIterator<T, IteratedObject> & operator++() {
00157         if (_end_reached_ == 2) sthrow(IteratorException, "End of iterator");
00158         else if (_end_reached_ == 1) {
00159             _end_reached_ = 2;
00160             return *this;
00161         } else {
00162             next();
00163             if (!hasNext()) _end_reached_ = 1;
00164             return *this;
00165         }
00166     }
00167 
00168     const ForwardIterator<T, IteratedObject> operator++(int) const {
00169         ForwardIterator<T, IteratedObject> toReturn(*this);
00170         if (_end_reached_ == 2) sthrow(IteratorException, "End of iterator");
00171         else if (_end_reached_ == 1) {
00172             _end_reached_ = 2;
00173             return toReturn;
00174         } else {
00175             next();
00176             if (!hasNext()) _end_reached_ = 1;
00177             return *toReturn;
00178         }
00179     }
00180 
00181     ForwardIterator<T, IteratedObject> operator++(int) {
00182         ForwardIterator<T, IteratedObject> toReturn(*this);
00183         if (_end_reached_ == 2) sthrow(IteratorException, "End of iterator");
00184         else if (_end_reached_ == 1) {
00185             _end_reached_ = 2;
00186             return toReturn;
00187         } else {
00188             next();
00189             if (!hasNext()) _end_reached_ = 1;
00190             return *toReturn;
00191         }
00192     }
00193 
00194     ForwardIterator<T, IteratedObject> & operator=
00195             (const ForwardIterator<T, IteratedObject>& other) {
00196         copyFrom(other);
00197         _end_reached_ = other._end_reached_;
00198         return *this;
00199     }
00200 
00201     virtual bool operator==(const ForwardIterator<T, IteratedObject>& other) const {
00202         return (_end_reached_ == other._end_reached_) && equals(other);
00203     }
00204 
00205     bool operator!=(const ForwardIterator<T, IteratedObject>& other) const {
00206         return !(*this == other);
00207     }
00208 
00209 public:
00210     // Overridable functions
00220     virtual void construct(bool begin, IteratedObject* obj) const = 0;
00227     virtual pointer current() const = 0;
00233     virtual void next() const = 0;
00241     virtual bool hasNext() const = 0;
00250     virtual bool equals(const ForwardIterator<T, IteratedObject>& other) const = 0;
00257     virtual void copyFrom(ForwardIterator<T, IteratedObject>& other) const = 0;
00261     mutable unsigned char _end_reached_;
00262 };
00263 
00264 template<class T, class IteratedObject>
00265 class BidirectionalIterator : public ForwardIterator<T, IteratedObject> {
00266 public:
00267     typedef std::bidirectional_iterator_tag iterator_category;
00268 public:
00269 
00270     BidirectionalIterator() : _end_reached_(0) {
00271     }
00272 
00273     BidirectionalIterator(itr_begin_t, IteratedObject* obj) : _end_reached_(0) {
00274     }
00275 
00276     BidirectionalIterator(itr_end_t, IteratedObject* obj) : _end_reached_(2) {
00277     }
00278 
00279     BidirectionalIterator(BidirectionalIterator<T, IteratedObject>& other) :
00280     _end_reached_(other._end_reached_) {
00281         copyFrom(other);
00282     }
00283 
00284     BidirectionalIterator<T, IteratedObject> & operator--() {
00285         if (_end_reached_ == 2) {
00286             _end_reached_ = 1;
00287             return *this;
00288         } else if (!hasPrevious()) {
00289             sthrow(IteratorException, "Begin of iterator");
00290         } else {
00291             if (_end_reached_ == 1) _end_reached_ = 0;
00292             previous();
00293             return *this;
00294         }
00295     }
00296 
00297     const BidirectionalIterator<T, IteratedObject> & operator--() const {
00298         if (_end_reached_ == 2) {
00299             _end_reached_ = 1;
00300             return *this;
00301         } else if (!hasPrevious()) {
00302             sthrow(IteratorException, "Begin of iterator");
00303         } else {
00304             if (_end_reached_ == 1) _end_reached_ = 0;
00305             previous();
00306             return *this;
00307         }
00308     }
00309 
00310     BidirectionalIterator<T, IteratedObject> operator--(int) {
00311         BidirectionalIterator toReturn(*this);
00312         if (_end_reached_ == 2) {
00313             _end_reached_ = 1;
00314             return *toReturn;
00315         } else if (!hasPrevious()) {
00316             sthrow(IteratorException, "Begin of iterator");
00317         } else {
00318             if (_end_reached_ == 1) _end_reached_ = 0;
00319             previous();
00320             return *toReturn;
00321         }
00322     }
00323 
00324     const BidirectionalIterator<T, IteratedObject> operator--(int) const {
00325         BidirectionalIterator toReturn(*this);
00326         if (_end_reached_ == 2) {
00327             _end_reached_ = 1;
00328             return *toReturn;
00329         } else if (!hasPrevious()) {
00330             sthrow(IteratorException, "Begin of iterator");
00331         } else {
00332             if (_end_reached_ == 1) _end_reached_ = 0;
00333             previous();
00334             return *toReturn;
00335         }
00336     }
00337 
00338     bool operator==(const BidirectionalIterator<T, IteratedObject>& other) const {
00339         return ((_end_reached_ == other._end_reached_) ||
00340                 (hasPrevious() == other.hasPrevious())) && equals(other);
00341     }
00342 public:
00343     virtual bool hasPrevious() const = 0;
00344     virtual void previous() const = 0;
00345 };
00346 
00347 template<class T, class IteratedObject>
00348 class RandomAccessIterator : public BidirectionalIterator<T, IteratedObject> {
00349 public:
00350     typedef std::random_access_iterator_tag iterator_category;
00351 public:
00352 
00353     RandomAccessIterator() : _end_reached_(0) {
00354     }
00355 
00356     RandomAccessIterator(itr_begin_t, IteratedObject* obj) : _end_reached_(0) {
00357     }
00358 
00359     RandomAccessIterator(itr_end_t, IteratedObject* obj) : _end_reached_(2) {
00360     }
00361 
00362     RandomAccessIterator(BidirectionalIterator<T, IteratedObject>& other) :
00363     _end_reached_(other._end_reached_) {
00364         copyFrom(other);
00365     }
00366 
00367     RandomAccessIterator<T, IteratedObject> & operator+=(unsigned int i) {
00368         ptrdiff_t diff = i;
00369         if (i >= 0) while (diff--) ++(*this);
00370         else while (diff++) --(*this);
00371         return *this;
00372     }
00373 
00374     const RandomAccessIterator<T, IteratedObject> & operator+=
00375             (unsigned int i) const {
00376         ptrdiff_t diff = i;
00377         if (i >= 0) while (diff--) ++(*this);
00378         else while (diff++) --(*this);
00379         return *this;
00380     }
00381 
00382     RandomAccessIterator<T, IteratedObject> & operator-=(unsigned int i) {
00383         return *this += -i;
00384     }
00385 
00386     const RandomAccessIterator<T, IteratedObject> & operator-=
00387             (unsigned int i) const {
00388         return *this += -i;
00389     }
00390 
00391     const RandomAccessIterator<T, IteratedObject> operator+
00392     (unsigned int i) const {
00393         RandomAccessIterator<T, IteratedObject> toReturn(*this);
00394         return toReturn += i;
00395     }
00396 
00397     RandomAccessIterator<T, IteratedObject> operator-(unsigned int i) {
00398         return *this + -i;
00399     }
00400 
00401     ptrdiff_t operator-(const RandomAccessIterator<T, IteratedObject>&
00402             other) const {
00403         if (*this > other) return this->currentIndex() - other.currentIndex();
00404         else return other.currentIndex() - this->currentIndex();
00405     }
00406 
00407     const reference operator[](unsigned int offset) const {
00408         return *(*this +offset);
00409     }
00410 
00411     reference operator[](unsigned int offset) {
00412         return *(*this +offset);
00413     }
00414 
00415     bool operator>(const RandomAccessIterator<T, IteratedObject>&
00416             other) const {
00417         return this->currentIndex() > other.currentIndex();
00418     }
00419 
00420     bool operator<(const RandomAccessIterator<T, IteratedObject>&
00421             other) const {
00422         return this->currentIndex() < other.currentIndex();
00423     }
00424 
00425     bool operator>=(const RandomAccessIterator<T, IteratedObject>&
00426             other) const {
00427         return this->currentIndex() >= other.currentIndex();
00428     }
00429 
00430     bool operator<=(const RandomAccessIterator<T, IteratedObject>&
00431             other) const {
00432         return this->currentIndex() <= other.currentIndex();
00433     }
00434 
00435 public:
00436     virtual idx_t currentIndex() = 0;
00437     virtual size_t length() = 0;
00438 };
00439 
00440 template<T, IteratedObject>
00441 RandomAccessIterator<T, IteratedObject> operator+
00442     (unsigned int i, const RandomAccessIterator<T, IteratedObject> itr) {
00443     return itr+i;
00444 }

00454 template<class Iter>
00455 class SylphIterator : public virtual Object {
00456 public:
00457 
00465     inline SylphIterator(Iter & it) : itr(it) {
00466     }
00467 
00471     inline virtual ~SylphIterator() {
00472     }
00473 
00478     virtual bool hasNext() const {
00479         return itr.hasNext();
00480     }
00487     virtual const typename Iter::reference next() const {
00488         Iter::reference toReturn = *itr;
00489         ++itr;
00490         return toReturn;
00491     }
00498     virtual bool hasPrevious() const {
00499         return itr.hasPrevious();
00500     }
00509     virtual const typename Iter::reference previous() const {
00510         --itr;
00511         return *itr;
00512     }
00513 
00521     virtual void front() const {
00522         while(itr.hasPrevious()) --itr;
00523     }
00524 
00533     virtual void back() const {
00534         while(itr.hasNext()) ++itr;
00535     }
00536 
00544     virtual std::idx_t nextIndex() const {
00545         return itr.currentIndex();
00546     }
00547 
00555     virtual std::idx_t previousIndex() const {
00556         return itr.currentIndex() - 1;
00557     }
00558 
00564     virtual void set(typename Iter::reference t) {
00565         *itr = t;
00566     }
00567 
00571     const typename Iter::reference operator++() const {
00572         return next();
00573     }
00574 
00578     const typename Iter::reference operator--() const {
00579         return previous();
00580     }
00581 
00586     const typename Iter::reference operator++(int) const {
00587         return next();
00588     }
00589 
00594     const typename Iter::reference operator--(int) const {
00595         return previous();
00596     }
00597 private:
00598     Iter itr;
00599 };

00601 #define S_CREATE_SYLPH_ITERATOR(Class) \
00602 typedef SylphIterator< Class##::iterator > Class##Iterator; \
00603 template<class T> \
00604 const Class##Iterator Class##<T>::getIterator() { \
00605     return Class##Iterator(this->begin()); \
00606 }\
00607 template<class T>\
00608 Class##Iterator Class##<T>::getMutableIterator() { \
00609     return Class##Iterator(this->begin()); \
00610 }

00620 template<class T>
00621 class s_foreach_container_fjAk8tb1 : public s_foreach_container_base_7tQmTc4i {
00622 public:
00623 
00624     inline s_foreach_container_fjAk8tb1(const T& t) : c(t), brk(0), i(c) {
00625     };
00626     const T c;
00627     mutable int brk;
00628     typename T::Iterator i;
00629 
00630     inline bool condition() const {
00631         return (!brk++ && i.hasNext());
00632     }
00633 };

00635 template<class T>
00636 inline s_foreach_container_base_7tQmTc4i s_foreach_container_new(const T & t) {
00637     return s_foreach_container_fjAk8tb1<T > (t);
00638 }

00640 template<class T>

00642 const s_foreach_container_base_7tQmTc4i& bas, const T&) {
00643     return static_cast<s_foreach_container_fjAk8tb1<T> > (bas);
00644 }

00646 #define sforeach(variable,container) \
00647 for (s_foreach_container_base_7tQmTc4i & _container_ = \
00648          s_foreach_container_new(container); \
00649          sf_cast(_container_,container)->condition(); )               \
00650         for (variable = sf_cast(_container_, container)->i++; \
00651          sf_cast(_container_, container)->brk; \
00652              --sf_cast(_container_, container)->brk)
